meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of slush
meanings.sent1: The sidewalk became slushier after the snow started melting.
meanings.sent2: Her boots were slushier than mine after walking through the wet snow.
meanings.sent3: The slushier ground made it tricky for the dog to find a dry spot to sit.
meanings.sent4: The slushier roads slowed down the traffic to a crawl.
meanings.sent5: The slushier mixture of snow and rain made a squelching sound underfoot.

meanings.sent1: The slushier ice cream melted quickly in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The slushier snow was perfect for making snowballs.
meanings.sent3: The slushier mud made it hard to walk without slipping.
meanings.sent4: The slushier smoothie was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The slushier texture of the slushie made it extra enjoyable to drink.

meanings.sent1: As the temperature rose, the snow became slushier.
meanings.sent2: The slushier mixture of snow and rain made a mess on the roads.
meanings.sent3: The slushier consistency of the drink made it easier to sip.
meanings.sent4: The slushier snow made it harder to build a snowman.
meanings.sent5: The slushier puddles formed as the snow started to melt.
